Great idea!
Shulkers are my favorite mobs so seeing a suggestion on them, I will always support :)

Instead, why don't you just add a fermented spider eye to a potion of slow falling. The fermented spider eye works as a potion corruptor for night vision, healing and swiftness, so why not for the slow falling potion? This would make the potion much easier to get and could therefore help the player in parts of the game like the Ender Dragon fight.
Unecessary, we don't need any other low tier materials that don't have anything special to offer

I love the idea, but to add this they would need to completely overhaul the progression of the game. I would suggest making iron spawn lower down so the player is ought to find copper first. And maybe making it so copper amour and tools can be “charged” to create a sort of power amour that would have special effects (helmet-glowing, chestplate-reverse knock back, leggings-jump boost, boots-speed boost, etc.

It would be really cool if iron was changed as well. Just make almost every iron item be crafted from steel. Steel would essentially replace iron, but because you would need to make it from iron, you wouldn't necessarily skip copper tools, so they wouldn't be so useless.

I agree that they are too common.  I think they should be much rarer, perhaps nearly as rare as strongholds, and that there should be a special way to find them.  My proposal is that compasses go haywire when standing in a chunk with a higher than normal iron or copper ore content, mimicking the magnetic anomalies caused by some large iron deposits IRL.  That way, the player could find regions with veins in them while exploring the surface, which is more of a mid or late game activity.

374486872311, that's a great idea. If ore veins were too common it would completely destroy early game progression, but if they were too rare and without a way to find them, players couldn't reliably find them in the late game. The idea for compasses to malfunction around ore deposits is genius--it's a real phenomenon, it gives a use to compasses, and feels a lot closer to vanilla than things like "ore maps". Some suggestions to expand on your idea: When the player's x/z coordinates are within, say, 30 blocks of any part of an ore vein, compasses would start to slightly move back and forth, but barely noticeably. The closer the player gets to the vein (in terms of x/z coordinates), the more it'll spin and generally act weird. And if the player is higher or lower than the vein, the spinning will be slightly less noticeable--this way the player can still detect a vein from the surface, but be able to zero in on its depth.

And @Melly Dow, I might be misunderstanding what you mean by "early game", but in my experience, the early game is gathering basic resources and mining enough iron for basic gear. Iron farms aren't made until the mid/late game, since they can be pretty complicated to build, and in the scope of the early game, one doesn't need stacks of iron. I think making ore veins harder to find (and adding the compass mechanic) would make vein mining at least as viable as iron farming in late game. And yes, mining in deepslate is slow, but that's what enchanted pickaxes are for. Iron farming has always seemed like an exploit to me, so it's good to know there's a legitimate way to get masses of iron.

I really like the new rarity of ore veins. They are rare enough to not be reliably found in the early game, but they're also a great source of iron in the late game. During the late game, I recently explored a huge cave, and by the end of it, I found a large iron vein. The iron vein looked amazing as it sprawled throughout the cavern, and it was very satisfying to mine due to the variation of blocks.
Thats a great idea!
people could exploit the feature and use it to find hidden structures. Plus you're supposed to get lost underground: that's what makes caving fun

In reply to another comment.
If we adjust the Y level of the map, it's only 1 Y level. It'll only overview everything open below that coordinate. It wouldn't be useful for cave exploration, but rather to take an image of something underground. like a secret base, flat art, or maybe a cool big cave.
I'd also expect that if the y coordinate is changed, you would have to re-explore either exactly that coordinate or nearby y coordinates by 2 or 3.

When you said ski lodge, my mind immediately thought of an evoker sitting by a warm fire as his vindicator and illusioner buddies got ready to hit the slopes. Then, after the vindicators and illusioners have left, the evoker summons a swarm of vexes to keep him company.

In all seriousness, the idea is great. It adds more incentive to find the rare, illusive mountains. As for structure ideas, why not a mining lodge? Kind of a combination of the ski lodge and a mining village. Seeing as the mountains will have a bounty of emeralds, it would only make sense that villagers would swarm the cliffs in search for riches. As part of the lodge/village, there could be emerald vaults, or the chests found around the lodge/village could have emeralds instead of the random items found in normal village chests. Just a thought.
Or add a Headlamp which can be crafted with glass and a cande. Would fit into the Cave update.
a miners helmet could be useful and crafted with copper as it doesnt have many uses at this time
To be clear the part where the player must get it down to half health to tame it is another layer of difficulty. The player must know how much damage their weapon does and plan hits accordingly.

The Glow Lichen actually offer enough light for your to look around and be able to traverse the caves, and they're very balanced since they have a light level of 7 which allows mobs to spawn. I don't think another light source is necessary. I like the Watch Tower idea.

I feel like moss generating next to lava should be converted to dirt also, i really like the atmosphere than a lava lake can bring to a lush cave, it just need a smooth transition!

Well, in this case, should we be able to use Quartz as well? Quartz is kind of similar in uses to copper- some actual recipe uses, but mostly for decoration blocks. However, copper is even more easily acquired, due to the fact that copper drops more than 1 raw copper/ore. A good proposal though, and I'd like to see this in-game (especially because you can see your beacon base aging, showing you how long that beacon has been helping you)
